thought: ["Claude Code's auto-delegation is legit. Ask for something complex, it spins up research or plan sub-agents automatically. My custom sub-agents are collecting dust now.", "Context window management is what sells it. Claude decides when to delegate vs handle directly, keeps the main context clean. Opus 4.5 made this smootherâ€”fewer tokens, longer sessions.", "One quirk: Claude started dumping plans into random .md files I never asked for. Now it reads those instead of my actual docs. Gotta type \"read from my docs\" every time ðŸ˜…", "Still the best terminal coding experience I've had. Anyone else finding auto-delegation kills the need for custom setups?"]
